comments:
InvocationTargetException while executing EMF JET Tutorial # 2

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-JET2/jet_tutorial2.html

Tested on:  IES build I20050519 (200505191601)
JRE Used: ibm-java2-ec-jre-pj9n142sr1a-20050218.zip


Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Unzip org.eclipse.emf.examples.jet.article2_2.0.0.zip into the plugins 
directory of the eclipse install.

2. Create a Java project.  Create a Type Safe Enumeration from New --> Other --
> Java --> Type Safe Enum

3. Specify the name and value in the Type Safe Enum dialog and add a few 
enumerations.

4. Hit the Finish button for the system to generate the Type Safe Enum Java 
code.

Result:  The code is not generated but an InvocationTargetException occurs. 
See below for details.

The tutorial code uses a method that has moved.  Please see:
http://eclipse.org/emf/docs.php?doc=docs/whatsnew/tools2.1.html#refactoring

We'll have to update the tutorial code, but this is not an indication of a
problem in EMF.

The fix is trivial.  In JETGateway.findOrCreateContainer()

IContainer container = CodeGen.findOrCreateContainer( ... );

should change to

IContainer container = CodeGenUtil.findOrCreateContainer( ... );

All of the static utility-type methods in the codegen plug-in have moved from
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.CodeGen to org.eclipse.emf.codegen.util.CodeGenUtil.

I notice that the source isn't versioned in our CVS, there's just the complete
example plug-in.  Are we maintaining this code, or is Remko?

Note that this will break the sample for older versions of EMF.  Perhaps we
should keep both versions around.
We've put back as deprecated the old methods and classes.
